title: Op Sindoor diplomacy: Why BJP is pushing Tharoor but Congress is not
content: Shashi Tharoor's inclusion in the Operation Sindoor outreach program has sparked controversy, with the Congress party distancing itself from his pro-government stance on the India-Pakistan issue. Despite Congress suggesting other names, the government chose Tharoor to lead the delegation. In the recent past, Tharoor’s unflinching support for the government during the India-Pakistan standoff has raised eyebrows within his party.

title: 'Misrepresentation of facts': MEA clarifies Jaishankar's 'warned Pak' remark
content: The Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) refuted Rahul Gandhi's allegation that External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar alerted Pakistan before Operation Sindoor. MEA clarified that Pakistan was warned at the early phase after the operation's commencement, countering the misrepresentation of facts.

title: Who is Jyoti Malhotra, YouTuber arrested for spying for Pakistan
content: Jyoti Malhotra, a travel vlogger from Haryana, has been arrested. She is accused of sharing sensitive information with Pakistani intelligence operatives. Malhotra, known as “Travel with Jo,” allegedly contacted Pakistani officials through messaging apps. Authorities claim her actions violated the Official Secrets Act. She is accused of posing a threat to national security. Investigations are currently underway.

title: Sorry Google, Microsoft CEO finds DeepSeek's R1 only AI model close to OpenAI's
content: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella lauded DeepSeek's R1 as a formidable competitor to OpenAI's models, surpassing even Google's Gemini in performance. This recognition, along with praise from OpenAI's Sam Altman and Google's Sundar Pichai, highlights DeepSeek's significant impact on the AI landscape. R1's cost-effectiveness has stirred market concerns about AI hardware demand.

title: Virat Kohli in County Cricket? Middlesex hope to lure the Indian star
content: Middlesex is reportedly keen on signing Virat Kohli for a stint at Lord's, aiming to add the Indian superstar to their roster. Despite his Test retirement, Kohli hasn't ruled out first-class cricket, opening the door for a potential County Championship or One-Day Cup appearance.

title: How India used 'dummy pilotless aircraft' during counter-strikes on Pak airbases
content: On May 9-10, the Indian Air Force decimated 11 Pakistani airbases in retaliation for attacks on 26 Indian locations following "Operation Sindoor." India's air defenses successfully countered Pakistan's initial strikes. The IAF employed dummy aircraft, loitering munitions, and long-range missiles like BrahMos and Scalp, crippling Pakistan's air defense and forcing a DGMO-level ceasefire agreement.

title: How Jyoti Malhotra passed secret information to Pakistan: Apps used and more
content: Indian YouTuber Jyoti Malhotra, known for her "Travel with JO" channel, has been arrested in Hisar on suspicion of spying for Pakistan. Police allege Malhotra shared sensitive information with Pakistani intelligence operatives via WhatsApp, Telegram, and Snapchat. Officials claim her actions violate the Official Secrets Act and pose a national security threat.

title: India seeks peace, but has strength to teach lesson: RSS chief on Op Sindoor
content: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat asserted that India is dedicated to global peace but possesses the strength to retaliate if provoked. He highlighted India's commitment to global welfare, emphasising that the world respects strength. Bhagwat cited India's assistance to Sri Lanka, Nepal, and the Maldives during crises, underscoring the nation's dedication to helping others despite occasional challenges.

title: RCB vs KKR: What is the cut-off time for a 5-over game?
content: Persistent rain has delayed the toss for the crucial IPL 2025 match between Royal Challengers Bengaluru and Kolkata Knight Riders at the M. Chinnaswamy Stadium. RCB needs a win to secure a playoff spot, while KKR's playoff hopes hinge on winning their remaining matches. The game marks the return of IPL after a brief suspension.

title: Bill Gates on Zuckerberg's plan to give away his wealth: There are people like ...
content: Bill Gates has praised Mark Zuckerberg's commitment to donate 90% of his wealth through the Chan-Zuckerberg Initiative, highlighting Zuckerberg as a key figure in the next generation of philanthropists. Gates himself plans to donate 99% of his wealth to the Gates Foundation within 20 years, emphasizing the growing trend of tech entrepreneurs engaging in significant charitable giving.

title: Watch: Horrific! Tsunoda's F1 car in pieces after shocking crash
content: Yuki Tsunoda experienced a high-speed crash during the Emilia Romagna Grand Prix qualifying, losing control at Variante Villeneuve and colliding with the barriers at 240kph. The session was red-flagged as Tsunoda emerged unharmed, prompting concern from other drivers. This incident served as a stark reminder of the circuit's dangers, reminiscent of the fatal accidents in 1994.

title: Why Pakistan's Arshad didn't compete against Neeraj at Doha DL
content: Neeraj Chopra showcased his prowess at the Doha Diamond League, achieving a personal best of 90.23m, though finishing second to Julian Weber. Arshad Nadeem, however, was absent, strategically focusing on preparations for the upcoming Asian Athletics Championships in Gumi. Chopra's performance, guided by coach Jan Zelezny, signals strong momentum heading into the World Championships in Tokyo.

title: More iPhones from India soon amid Trump’s warning to Apple
content: Foxconn is poised to begin iPhone shipments from its Karnataka facility in June, aiming to make it their second-largest iPhone manufacturing hub after China. Despite pressure from Donald Trump to manufacture in the US, Apple seems to be proceeding with its India expansion plans.

title: 'Centre chose ...': Tharoor on Cong not naming him for all-party delegation
content: Shashi Tharoor addressed his inclusion in an all-party delegation despite not being nominated by the Congress, stating the government chose who they deemed fit. He affirmed his commitment to the role, dismissing political undertones. This situation sparked reactions, with Congress leaders making veiled criticisms and the BJP questioning the Congress's motives for excluding Tharoor.

title: Setback in Delhi as 13 councillors quit AAP, float new party
content: In a setback for the Aam Aadmi Party, 13 MCD councillors resigned, forming the Indraprastha Vikas Party, citing lack of development and internal strife. Led by Mukesh Goyal, the new party will focus on municipal issues. AAP alleges BJP induced the defections with financial offers to gain control of MCD committees.

title: Panthers shut out in Game 6, face win-or-go-home Game 7 vs Maple Leafs
content: The Florida Panthers dominated early Stanley Cup Playoffs with 17 different goal scorers, but Game 6 against the Toronto Maple Leafs exposed their struggles. With a chance to reach the Eastern Conference Final, Florida’s offense went silent, failing to score and losing momentum. Now, the Panthers face a critical Game 7, fighting to prove they’re still playoff contenders.

title: No talks of Kohli retirement! Salt reveals dressing room secret
content: Virat Kohli's return to the IPL after his Test retirement announcement was met with a massive fan tribute at M. Chinnaswamy Stadium, despite rain delays. RCB faced KKR in a crucial match, with playoff implications for both teams. Phil Salt revealed the team's focus remained on the IPL playoffs, not Kohli's Test decision.

title: GT look to seal playoff berth as DC seek fresh start after IPL suspension
content: Delhi Capitals and Gujarat Titans are set to clash in a crucial match at the Arun Jaitley Stadium, with GT aiming to secure a playoff spot. Rescheduled IPL has impacted team compositions, with key overseas players unavailable for both sides. DC face challenges replacing Mitchell Starc, while GT remain confident despite losing Jos Buttler and Kagiso Rabada.

title: After Balochistan, protesters slam Pakistan’s human rights violations in Sindh
content: The Jeay Sindh Freedom Movement held a highway sit-in, demanding the release of jailed Sindhi nationalists and protesting human rights abuses in Sindh and Balochistan. JSFM leaders urged international organisations to intervene, highlighting enforced disappearances and mistreatment of detainees. The protest follows reports of extrajudicial killings and concerns over forced conversions, as well as Balochistan's declaration of independence.

title: 'You hit so many sixes, they had to name a stand after you!': Dravid to Rohit
content: Rahul Dravid honored Rohit Sharma after a stand was named after him at Wankhede Stadium. The Mumbai Cricket Association felicitated Rohit, Ajit Wadekar, and Sharad Pawar. Each received the honor of a stand in their name. Dravid shared a video message filled with humor and respect. He acknowledged Rohit's contributions to Mumbai and Indian cricket.

title: America's next top immigrant? US mulls reality TV competition for citizenship
content: The US Department of Homeland Security is considering a reality TV show where immigrants compete for citizenship. Pitched by Rob Worsoff, the show aims to highlight American ideals through challenges like a gold rush and assembling a Model T. Contestants would arrive at Ellis Island, with one eliminated each episode.

title: What is Tulbul Project and why it’s important for India
content: The Tulbul Navigation Project, stalled by Pakistan in 1987, may restart. Experts say it benefits Jammu and Kashmir. Omar Abdullah supports reviving the project. The project aims to improve navigation on the Jhelum river. It could also help with flood management and power generation. India believes the project aligns with the Indus Waters Treaty.

title: Rs 50k/month, countless sacrifices: India’s chess future in Chennai hut
content: GM Shyam Sundar's Chennai-based academy is making waves by producing elite chess prodigies, including India's 86th grandmaster Srihari LR and FIDE Junior World Champion Pranav V. Shyam's coaching emphasises character, structured training, and camaraderie, fostering a supportive environment where students thrive. Despite financial challenges and personal sacrifices, Shyam remains dedicated to nurturing champions and instilling valuable life lessons.

title: 'Confront Pak but ... ': Owaisi's advice for PM Modi regarding Kashmiris
content: Asaduddin Owaisi urges the Indian government to seize the opportunity presented by spontaneous anti-Pakistan protests in Kashmir following the Pahalgam attack. He advises PM Modi and Amit Shah to embrace Kashmiris by ensuring their rights and protection, while simultaneously confronting Pakistan's destabilizing activities. Owaisi is also part of an all-party delegation for diplomatic outreach against cross-border terrorism.

title: When Anju Mahendru asked Dimple Kapadia to leave Rajesh Khanna’s birthday party
content: Rajesh Khanna's love life, a Bollywood saga, was marked by his relationship with Anju Mahendru. Their bond frayed due to his possessiveness and her career focus, especially after her link to Gary Sobers. Post-breakup, Khanna married Dimple Kapadia, creating tension with Anju. A birthday party incident highlighted the strained dynamics, with Dimple's sharp remarks adding to the awkwardness.

title: Top 5 entertainment news
content: Aamir Khan Productions displays the Indian flag amidst boycott calls, while Raj Nidimoru's ex-wife posts a cryptic message amid rumors involving Samantha Ruth Prabhu. Ishaan Khatter halts an interview when questioned about his girlfriend. Dr. Shriram Nene humorously debunks a venom-sucking scene, and Suniel Shetty proudly discusses Athiya's natural delivery, praising her strength and composure during childbirth.

title: Cam Newton shuts down Antonio Brown’s attacks on Shilo and Shedeur Sanders
content: Cam Newton has entered the fray between Antonio Brown and the Sanders family, defending Shilo Sanders against Brown's social media criticisms. Newton, armed with unseen evidence from Shilo, disputes Brown's edited training video, highlighting a competitive context misrepresented by selective clips. He challenges Brown to respond within 24 hours, advocating for Shilo's professional aspirations amidst the controversy.

title: Op Sindoor: BJP defends MP deputy CM as row erupts over his remarks
content: Madhya Pradesh Deputy CM Jagdish Devda's remark praising PM Modi and the army during 'Op Sindoor' sparked controversy, with Congress alleging he implied soldiers are at Modi's feet. BJP defended Devda, accusing Congress of targeting him for being Dalit. Devda refuted the claims, asserting he meant the nation salutes the army's bravery.

title: 250-year-old living Chinese man's 5 secrets to longevity
content: Li Ching-yun, a Chinese herbalist, is believed to have lived for an astounding 256 years. He attributed his longevity to inner peace, a diet of specific herbs like lingzhi and ginseng, and simple lifestyle practices. His advice included maintaining a calm heart, gentle exercise, and restful sleep, reflecting a life dedicated to simplicity and well-being.

title: 'Sharam nai aati?': Haryana deputy speaker makes officials sit on ground
content: Krishan Middha, Deputy Speaker, created controversy in Jind. He made officials sit on the ground. This happened after they removed encroachments from the city market. HSVP officials conducted an anti-encroachment drive. Middha confronted the officer. He alleged HSVP demolished shops of poor vendors without notice. Middha promised to compensate the affected shopkeepers. Officials remained silent on the matter.

title: 'Pakistan should be listed as terrorist state': Kapil Sibal demands amendment in UAPA
content: Kapil Sibal advocates for designating Pakistan as a terrorist state at the UN, emphasizing that it is a factory of terrorism. He highlighted the reduction in terrorist attacks in Jammu and Kashmir during Manmohan Singh's tenure. Sibal welcomed the all-party delegation's international visits to address cross-border terrorism following Operation Sindoor and the subsequent ceasefire.

title: Roorkee professor ‘molests’ 12 college students during viva
content: Abdul Aleem Ansari, an assistant professor, has been arrested for allegedly molesting around 12 undergraduate women during a physics practical examination at KLDAV PG College in Roorkee. The victims reported inappropriate touching and harassment during viva voce tests in a closed room.

title: From India–Pak ceasefire to $2 trillion deals and Qatari jet gift: What Trump said
content: Donald Trump, in a Fox News interview, hailed his Middle East tour as a major success, securing $2 trillion in investments and strengthening ties. He defended accepting a Boeing jet from Qatar, asserting it was for the US Air Force. Trump claimed his policies prevented Iran from acquiring nuclear weapons and that he de-escalated tensions between India and Pakistan.

title: Germany: Dozens injured at Berlin pro-Palestinian protest
content: Violent clashes erupted in Berlin during a pro-Palestinian Nakba Day demonstration, resulting in injuries to both protesters and police. Over 50 arrests were made after approximately 1,100 people gathered to remember the Nakba and protest Israeli military actions. Demonstrators reportedly shouted anti-Israel slogans, leading to police intervention and escalating violence.

title: Car runs over techie, killing him, after he refuses to buy cigarettes
content: In Bengaluru, a 29-year-old software engineer, H.N. Sanjay, died after a dispute over a cigarette request escalated. Sanjay refused a stranger's request to buy a cigarette, leading to an argument. The accused then allegedly rammed Sanjay's motorcycle, causing fatal head injuries. Police have registered a murder case and are investigating the incident using CCTV footage.

title: Crew attacks, pushes elderly man off Chennai bus for occupying differently-abled seat
content: An elderly passenger was assaulted and forcibly removed from a Chennai MTC bus by the driver and conductor for sitting in a designated seat. Conductor Nathar Pichai verbally abused the man before physically attacking him, joined by driver Azhagan.

title: Indian and US Air Forces team up to fix US C-17 aircraft at Jaipur airbase
content: A US Air Force C-17 Globemaster III experienced a technical issue at Jaipur airbase, which was promptly resolved through the joint efforts of Indian and US Air Force maintenance teams. This swift collaboration highlights the strong logistical coordination and growing partnership between the two air forces. Their cooperation underscores a commitment to readiness and mutual support in the Indo-Pacific region.

title: Newly married man beats wife to death with sticks in UP
content: In a tragic incident in Varanasi, a 26-year-old woman, Aarti Pal, was allegedly beaten to death by her husband, Raju Pal, just a week after their wedding. Police arrested Raju, who has a history of failed marriages, following a domestic dispute at Amouli village. Aarti's family alerted the authorities after Raju informed them of the assault.

title: KL Rahul likely to open for Delhi Capitals in remainder of IPL 2025
content: Delhi Capitals are contemplating a batting order reshuffle, potentially promoting KL Rahul to opener for their remaining IPL matches. Aiming to solidify their top order amidst inconsistencies and injuries, DC seeks stability as they face crucial games against Gujarat Titans, Mumbai Indians, and Punjab Kings to secure a playoff spot. With Mitchell Starc's absence, the bowling unit must step up.

title: Scuffling O's fire manager Hyde after slow start
content: The Baltimore Orioles fired manager Brandon Hyde on Saturday, hoping a new leader can spark a turnaround of the most disappointing team in Major League Baseball.

title: Knicks finish off Celtics as fans rejoice in NYC
content: The Knicks reached the Eastern Conference finals for the first time in 25 years and ended the one-year NBA title reign of the Celtics with astonishing ease, rolling to a 119-81 victory in Game 6.

title: Sources: Purdy, 49ers reach 5-year, $265M deal
content: Brock Purdy, the last pick in the 2022 NFL draft who has gone on to become a Pro Bowler, is finalizing a five-year, $265M deal with the 49ers, sources told ESPN's Adam Schefter.

title: Armstrong injured in crash before Indy 500 quals
content: Marcus Armstrong was taken away on a stretcher after a heavy crash in practice for Indianapolis 500 qualifying, and it was unclear who would get into Meyer Shank Racing's backup car even if it is ready to make a four-lap run later Saturday.

title: Brown: Loss to Knicks 'feels like death,' but life after
content: After a 38-point drubbing by the Knicks in Game 6 ended the Celtics' reign as NBA champions, Jaylen Brown acknowledged, "Finishing in May feels weird. It's definitely not something we were prepared for."

title: Report: Rory's driver ruled nonconforming at PGA
content: Rory McIlroy was forced to use a backup driver in the PGA Championship when his regular driver was tested and deemed to be nonconforming after he arrived at Quail Hollow, according to a report on SiriusXM PGA Tour Radio on Friday.

title: Plum meets hype with record 37 in Sparks debut
content: Kelsey Plum broke the WNBA record for most points in a season opener, scoring 37 in her Sparks debut Friday night in an 84-67 win over the Valkyries.

title: Mets' Soto listens to boos, tips hat in Bronx return
content: Juan Soto's return to Yankee Stadium in a Mets uniform Friday night went just about as he expected: with loud, relentless boos and chants from a scorned fanbase still offended by his offseason choice.

title: 📷 Bueckers leads WNBA's best dressed for debut
content: Before the WNBA's best take the floor, they dazzled the pregame tunnel with their opening-night outfits.

title: How Boston avoids breaking up its roster, plus offseason guides for every NBA team
content: NBA front office insider Bobby Marks breaks down the summer priorities and needs for every eliminated team.

title: Stanley Cup playoffs daily: Who wins Game 6 of Stars-Jets?
content: It's win or go home for Winnipeg as Dallas eyes the conference finals. Here are the keys to the showdown.

title: Will Aaron Judge hit .400? Blast 60 home runs? Our predictions based on his incredible start
content: The Yankees' superstar outfielder is outdoing even himself so far. Will he go over or under his current pace?

title: How Alexis DeBoer has made a name for herself with Washington softball
content: While her famous dad went to Alabama to coach the Tide, Alexis DeBoer followed her dream to play for the Huskies.

title: 49ers QB Brock Purdy is no longer Mr. Irrelevant: New contract comes with pressure to lead, win
content: San Francisco has long benefited from the league's best bargain contract. Now, it's on Purdy to deliver results.

title: UFC Fight Night: Does Burns have a best path to ending Morales' unbeaten run?
content: Who has the edge in this week's UFC Fight Night? An MMA coach and a betting insider make their picks.

title: Real Madrid confirm Huijsen signing; to play in CWC
content: Real Madrid have completed the signing of Bournemouth defender Dean Huijsen, the LaLiga club have confirmed.

title: Ancelotti happy with Madrid transfer backing
content: Carlo Ancelotti said he couldn't have asked for more from Real Madrid on signings, with the club now in the middle of a major defensive rebuild.

title: Sources: Marsch, Blackmon in talks for Canada NT
content: Canada men's national team manager Jesse Marsch has initiated discussions with Vancouver Whitecaps defender Tristan Blackmon about the possibility of him representing Canada, sources told ESPN.

title: Fastest to 25: Chawinga sets NWSL scoring record
content: Temwa Chawinga's goal on Friday night secured a 1-0 win for the Kansas City Current against the Orlando Pride, making her the quickest player in NWSL history to reach 25 goals.

title: Maresca: Stop judging Chelsea by past glories
content: Enzo Maresca has warned onlookers not to judge Chelsea against their past glory days and urged supporters to "trust" him after taking a significant step towards Champions League qualification.

title: Pep slams Prem scheduling: 9 years fighting this
content: Pep Guardiola has hit out at the Premier League over the scheduling of Manchester City's fixture against Bournemouth.

title: Salah: Don't boo TAA in final Liverpool games
content: Liverpool forward Mohamed Salah has called for fans not to boo teammate Trent Alexander-Arnold in the club's remaining games this season.

title: NWSL: Game should've stopped after King collapse
content: The National Women's Soccer League said that it would abandon future games that have life-threatening emergencies to players.

title: Who are the best coaches in college football? We rank the top 10
content: Kirby Smart has to be No. 1, or does he? What about Ryan Day? Or Marcus Freeman? Who made our list -- and why.

title: Derek Carr retired, then an avalanche of unanswered questions followed
content: Derek Carr surprisingly announced his retirement on May 10. The decision -- and the timing -- has insiders throughout the league talking.

title: Chelsea's struggles without Jackson make Champions League qualification uncertain
content: Chelsea barely beat Man United, but serious questions linger about whether the Blues can clinch a Champions League spot as Nicolas Jackson remains out.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Guéhi could hold out for free move to Barcelona, Real Madrid
content: Marc Guéhi could run down his contract at Crystal Palace and move to Barcelona or Real Madrid on a free transfer. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Welcome to Banditland: Buffalo eyeing an NLL championship three-peat
content: The Bandits are on the verge of history, while star Dhane Smith is also chasing down an all-time record -- owned by his coach.

title: States without protection for inter-faith, inter-caste couples in contempt of SC: Mihir Desai
content: Renowned rights lawyer calls for national legislation; credits Bombay HC’s intervention for Maharashtra’s SOPs on safeguarding couples

title: BSF South Bengal Frontier foils gold smuggling attempt, appeals for public help
content: Two smugglers caught with over 1 kg of gold worth ₹1.11 crore at North 24 Parganas border; BSF urges citizens to report smuggling via helpline

title: Brand Bengaluru Committee to propose creating multiple municipal corporations under GBA
content: The committee, chaired by B.S. Patil, held its first formal meeting on Saturday since the Act’s notification and began working on restructuring plans.

title: Bengaluru start-up develops ‘Papchup’, a papaya ketchup
content: Unlike many tomato ketchups, which have around 12%–18% tomato paste, Papchup has 50% papaya pulp; product will help papaya farmers get better prices for their crop, say the developers

title: Sajjala calls upon leaders to strengthen YSRCP for future elections
content: Party committees will be formed at various levels with the aim of enrolling 18 lakh members by the end of the year, says the YSRCP State coordinator

title: 20 Maoists arrested, arms and ammunition seized in Mulugu district
content: They were apprehended during separate vehicle checking and search operations at different places under Venkatapuram, Wazeedu and Kannaigudem police station limits on Friday and Saturday, the police said

title: J&K to employ Ex-Servicemen for guard duties
content: Proposal will see 435 of the ESM, who carry licensed personal weapons, deployed across all 20 districts for non-combatant static guard duties.

title: Clean and green programmes ensure a healthy life, says DGP
content: Harish Kumar Gupta takes part in ‘Swarnandhra – Swachh Andhra’ drive at the State Police Headquarters at Mangalagiri

title: Killer tiger caught on camera
content: Search to continue for the tiger that mauled to death a man at Kalikavu after the animal evaded the forest team.

title: Rajasthan finalises action plan for M-sand plot auctions to curb illegal mining
content: Policy push aims to promote manufactured sand as alternative to riverbed sand, ease supply constraints, and ensure environmental compliance

title: Rahul Gandhi targets Jaishankar’s remarks on informing Pakistan ‘at the start’ of Operation Sindoor
content: The Congress leader’s claims were ‘utter misrepresentation of facts’, the Ministry of External Affairs said

title: Free bus travel for women in Andhra Pradesh from August 15, says Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu
content: It is one of the Super Six promises made by the TDP in the run-up to the elections; rolling out welfare schemes and attracting investments are the government’s twin priorities, he says

title: Shakti scheme a resounding hit in Chamarajanagar
content: There has been a noticeable increase in the number of women visiting religious and tourist destinations across the district

title: Massive blaze guts over 30 shanties in Gurugram slum
content: According to eyewitnesses, the fire spread so fast that people did not even get a chance to take out their belongings from the shanties.

title: BRS MLAs demand roll back of Metro fare hike
content: Address an open letter to CM Revanth Reddy cautioning about people’s backlash if fare hike is not reversed

title: Repeat sexual predator sentenced 25 years of RI within 55 days of complaint in Odisha
content: This case is a powerful example of what proactive policing, scientific evidence gathering, and time-bound prosecution can achieve, says Jharsuguda SP

title: Nobel laureate Abhijit Banerjee to join TelanganaRising advisory board
content: The Nobel laureate spoke of the need to create unique short-term courses in traditional skills with modern design and appeal, marketing and the use of social media technology to help traditional artisans turn into modern entrepreneurs

title: Superstitions becoming widespread in society, says Pinarayi
content: Many national grants supporting research and higher education have now been removed or reduced, says Kerala Chief Minister

title: West Bengal official suspended for ‘tampering’ with electoral application forms
content: According to a notification by the Chief Electoral Officer, the accused misused an electoral official’s login credentials to allegedly dispose of certain application forms

title: Ten districts get new District Coordinators of Health Services
content: The move follows the Minister for Health, Medical Education and Family Welfare Y. Satya Kumar Yadav expressing concern over underperformance of a few officials

title: Police resort to lathi charge following tension at procession in Madanapalle
content: Situation turned tense when the rally reportedly took a diversion from the permitted route map and proceeded towards another direction, leading to objections from another group

title: Courts are not outside the ambit of the RTI Act: State Information Commission
content: Observing that officials of some subordinate courts are denying all information sought under the RTI Act, State Information Commissioner A. Abdul Hakkim says only judicial proceedings are exempted from disclosure under the Act

title: In Own Video, Proof Of 'Spy' YouTuber's Ties With Pak Official
content: Jyoti Malhotra, the travel YouTuber who has been arrested for spying for Pakistan, attended an Iftar dinner at the Pakistan High Commission in New Delhi last year and posted a video.

title: After Rahul Gandhi's 'Pak Informed' Post, Centre's 'Early Phase' Reply
content: Slamming Leader of Opposition Rahul Gandhi for his claim that informing Pakistan at the start of Operation Sindoor was a "crime", the BJP has accused him of spreading fake news.

title: How Microsoft's AI Helped Israeli Military In Its War Against Gaza
content: In a blog post, Microsoft stated that it had provided the Israeli military with software, professional services, Azure cloud storage, and Azure AI services, including language translation.

title: Tamil Nadu Backs State Officials Amid Probe Agency's Raids In Liquor Scam Case
content: Tamil Nadu Excise Minister S Muthusamy on Saturday alleged the Enforcement Directorate harassed state government officials in the probe over its allegation of a scam in state-run TASMAC and violated procedures mandated by the Supreme Court.

title: "Made Some Business Mistakes": Byju's Founder Amid Crisis
content: Byju Raveendran, founder of beleaguered edtech giant BYJU'S, acknowledged that the company made "some business mistakes" when it expanded "too fast" to 21 countries due to the 'mandate' from the world-class investors.

title: No Hearing In Rahul Gandhi's Defamation Case Due To Lawyers' Workshop
content: Hearing in a defamation case against Congress leader Rahul Gandhi in a Sultanpur court could not be held on Saturday due to a workshop of lawyers.

title: Deteriorating Character Of Society, People Not Ready To Stand For Truth: Top Court
content: Due to deteriorating character of society, people nowadays are not ready to stand for truth, the Supreme Court has observed as it asked the Maharashtra government why it was relying on a large number of witnesses for oral testimony.

title: Dalit Girl Gang-Raped On Way To School In UP, 15-Year-Old Among 3 Accused: Cops
content: A 14-year-old Dalit girl was allegedly raped by three youths, including a minor, when she was on her way to school here, police said on Saturday.

title: Man, 25, Suffers Heart Attack During Wedding Ritual In Karnataka, Dies
content: Soon after he tied the 'mangalsutra' (auspicious thread), a symbol that the couple is bound in matrimony, around the bride's neck, the 25-year-old man suffered a heart attack and died, leaving the constellation of friends and family in utter shock.

title: Cops In Northeast States Search For Kuki Student Leader In Manipur Hate Speech Case
content: The police in Manipur and four other states in the northeast are searching for the leader of a student body of the Kuki tribes against whom a first information report (FIR) has been filed for allegedly giving a hate speech against Meiteis.

title: Kerala Vigilance Charges Probe Agency's Official In Corruption Case
content: A senior official of the Enforcement Directorate (ED) has been booked by the Kerala Vigilance and Anti-Corruption Bureau in a corruption case.

title: Video: Moment When Air Ambulance Crash-Landed In Kedarnath
content: A video of an air ambulance helicopter making an emergency landing in Uttarakhand's Kedarnath after developing a technical snag has gone viral on social media.

title: Travel YouTuber Jyoti Malhotra Arrested For Spying For Pakistan
content: Jyoti Malhotra aka Jyoti Rani, who ran a travel account on YouTube called 'Travel With Jo', has been arrested from Hisar in Haryana for sharing Indian military information with Pakistan, police said on Saturday.

title: As Israel Launches Op 'Gideon's Chariots', How It Plans To 'Conquer' Gaza
content: Gaza's civil defense agency reported 100 fatalities on Friday due to Israeli strikes, while the IDF claims to have struck over 150 terror targets in the Gaza Strip within 24 hours.

title: He Jumps Into River After Argument With Wife. A Relative Jumps After Him, Dies
content: Shortly after an argument with his wife late on Friday night, 37-year-old Anupam Tiwari is reported to have jumped into a river in Lucknow. Twenty-year-old Shivam Upadhyay, a relative, also jumped into the river to save him.

title: "Has Pak Links": Himanta Sarma Seeks Gaurav Gogoi's Removal From Key Delegation On Operation Sindoor
content: After the Congress party nominated Assam MP Gaurav Gogoi to join an all-party delegation that will travel abroad to explain India's position on terrorism emanating from Pakistan, Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma raised a sharp objection.

title: Chinese Man Aboard Hong Kong-Delhi Air India Flight Arrested For Theft: Cops
content: A Chinese national, suspected to be a member of an organised global in-flight theft syndicate, has been arrested for allegedly stealing debit and credit cards from fellow passengers during a flight from Hong Kong to New Delhi, police said on Saturday

title: Month After Asaduddin Owaisi vs Nishikant Dubey Over Judiciary, MPs On Same Team
content: Less than a month after engaging in a sharp public exchange over the role and authority of India's Supreme Court, AIMIM president Asaduddin Owaisi and BJP MP Nishikant Dubey are now on the same team.

title: Gujarat Minister's Son Arrested In Rs 71 Crore Rural Jobs Scheme Scam: Cops
content: Gujarat Minister Bachubhai Khabad's son, Balvant Khabad, was arrested on Saturday for his alleged involvement in a Rs 71 crore MGNREGA scam where some contracted agencies received payments from the government without finishing work or supplying goods

title: Israeli Strikes Kill 146 Palestinians In Gaza In 24 hours: Report
content: Israel's airforce killed at least 146 Palestinians in new attacks on Gaza over the past 24 hours and injured many more, local health authorities said on Saturday, as the country appeared set to press ahead with a new ground offensive.

title: Tourist arrivals at all-time high in Idukki: Riyas
content: Tourism Minister virtually inaugurates the Kudiyetta Smarakam museum and District Tourism Promotion Council‘s  photo frames project

title: Citizens come together for patriotic Tiranga rally on Hussainsagar
content: Starting from Ambedkar statue, the Tricolour rally ended near M-47 Patton Tank that was captured from a defeated Pakistan army during the 1971 war.

title: Gold merchants’ unions trade charges over ‘fund collection’ for Messi’s visit
content: One group says ₹10,000 was collected from gold and silver merchants by the rival group to fund Messi’s visit to State, the latter denies charges

title: Tiruchi Corporation steps up water safety measures
content: Health officials are engaged in inspecting the water supply network, collecting water samples, chlorinating the water, and monitoring the chlorine level

title: Ramakanth Joshi of Manohara Granthamala is dead
content: He had been leading Manohara Granthamala since 1993 after the death of his father, the noted writer G.B. Joshi

title: Once a painful form of self-protection, tattooed faces are now rare among women in Kandhamal
content: In this remote Odisha district, tribal women once tattooed their faces to appear less attractive — a painful tradition born out of resistance to sexual exploitation by landlords, royals, and British colonial rulers

title: Conduct inquiry regarding power outage at NEET examination centre, HC directs NTA
content: Passes the order on a writ petition filed jointly by 13 students who sought re-examination for all affected students

title: Telangana CM launches two programmes to support existing women-led enterprises, cultivate innovation among youth
content: The Women Acceleration Programme aims to strengthen the capabilities of women entrepreneurs to scale sustainably and enhance their competitiveness, CEO of WE Hub explained

title: Karandlaje calls on woman, SC/ST entrepreneurs to use reservation
content: Union Minister of State for Labour and Employment, Micro, Small, and Medium Enterprises Shobha Karandlaje has called on the woman entrepreneurs and those from SC/ST communities to avail the 3% reservation given to them in supply of spare parts to public sector undertakings (PSUs) of union government.

title: Armed forces lauded for success in ‘Operation Sindoor’
content: SCR officers, RPF, Scouts and Guides and students participated in solidarity march in support of the operation

title: Transferring employees with utter disregard to their health, family or safety concerns is against human dignity, says Madras High Court
content: Justice C.V. Karthikeyan holds that transfers cannot be carried out in a mechanical or burdensome manner

title: Ongoing SC survey finds people from nomadic communities without even one govt. document
content: There are 51 nomadic and semi-nomadic tribes among the Scheduled Castes in Karnataka, besides 23 and 47 nomadic communities among the Scheduled Tribes and backward classes, respectively

title: Batala grenade scare: Punjab Police books man for placing bomb-like object for publicity stunt
content: Panic gripped the Focal Point area after the object appearing to be a grenade was found on Saturday (May 17, 2025) morning

title: Madhya Pradesh HC modifies earlier order, allows declaration of NEET-UG results nationwide
content: The court said that results may be announced for all centres across the country except the centres that were affected by a power outage in Indore

title: Paddy growers prepare for stir as banks refuse loans against PRS
content: Around 7,000 paddy farmers in Kottayam district alone are awaiting payments for the paddy procured during the current season. The total dues are estimated at approximately ₹81 crore.

title: TTD mulls changes to SRIVANI scheme to make it better, transparent
content: Executive Officer Syamala Rao seeks report on status of works pertaining to renovation of temples taken up under the aegis of Endowments Department

title: 80 colleges express interest in Campus Industrial Park programme
content: Industries department’s proposal aimed to attract investments, provide students an opportunity to test their entrepreneurial skills, and utilise land available on campuses in excess of academic requirements

title: Higher defence spends won’t stretch India’s finances: Economists
content: Higher expected dividends from the RBI and lower oil prices will provide fiscal flexibility, with the past also showing the deficit remaining contained during heightened tensions

title: Kadapa Collector inspects MGNREGA works after MP’s complaint
content: In the complaint, Y.S. Avinash Reddy accuses the TDP-led alliance government of ‘systematically subverting’ the scheme and resorting to large scale financial fraud

title: Reservoir to meet water needs of 52 bastis in Borabanda and Rahmathnagar inaugurated
content: Three-million-litre capacity reservoir built at a cost of ₹5.70 crore will address the low pressure and supply issues in the high-altitude areas and ensure water supply every alternate day

title: Quantum Valley will position A.P. as a leading centre for technology research, says Governor
content: Laurus Labs Limited founder & CEO Satyanarayana Chava conferred with the Degree of Honoris Causa at the 14th convocation of JNTU, Anantapur

title: PM Modi to launch revamped manuscripts mission on June 9
content: For this, the Union Budget had hiked the budgetary allocation for the existing National Manuscripts Mission (NMM) from ₹3.5 crore to ₹60 crore

title: Maintenance of hygiene at Tirumala is a collective responsibility, says TTD Additional EO
content: Ch. Venkaiah Chowdary urges the public to contribute to the best of their ability to maintain cleanliness atop the town visited by lakhs devotees every month

title: Row over wild elephant’s death: case against forest officials at Padam forest station
content: Officials booked following a complaint from a plantation worker alleging unlawful detention in connection with an elephant electrocution incident

title: A.P. Congress chief Sharmila urges Centre to stick to the original design of Polavaram project
content: Ahead of the PM’s review of the project, she says it is the Centre’s responsibility to complete it at the earliest, opposes any reduction in the project height from 45.7 metres as specified in the original design

title: Handing out grades for every full-time Cup driver: From four A's to a painful F
content: NASCAR's all-Star race festivities are in North Wilkesboro, North Carolina this weekend . a weighted combination of key performance indicators was used to compare drivers on an even scale . the formula included a variety of components, each standardized in order of importance . it's a chance to take stock of what has happened in the 2025 season so far .

title: NBA playoff takeaways: Knicks' Game 6 knockout gives New York conference finals berth
content: no. 4 seed Indiana Pacers beat the no. 1 seed Cleveland Cavaliers 2-0 in the Eastern and Western Conference semifinals . the playoffs are the second round of the 2025 playoffs for the first time since 2000 . it's the largest playoff win in franchise history for the Knicks in history .

title: Thibs, Brunson carryovers from last time Knicks were in the Eastern Conference finals
content: the new york Knicks are in the Eastern Conference finals for just the second time this century . the knicks defeated the Boston Celtics in Game 6 on friday, winning the series 4-2 . since the 1999-2000 season, the last time they were in the conference finals, they have had three chances to reach that stage again .

title: The 10 hottest times in New York baseball history

title: Potential upsets? Early favorites? We preview the 2025 softball regionals
content: the Oklahoma Sooners begin their quest for a fifth straight ring as the regionals begin on friday . eight of the overall top 10 seeds are from the conference . some of the best pitchers are playing for teams like Texas Tech (NiJaree Canady), Arizona State (Kenzie Brown).

title: 2025 WNBA predictions: Staff picks to win title, MVP, more
